prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: When will Stefan make his final decision about his marriage, or has he already done so?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

Due to the lack of planets in the Ascendant's 9th house, Stefan should be represented by Mars, the house ruler.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation, use only if needed for interpretation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical listing of the chart data relevant to your horary question, following strict horary principles:

1. Question Framework and Representation
 • Query: “When will Stefan make his final decision about his marriage, or has he already done so?”
 • Representation:
  – Melissa is represented by the Ascendant (1st house)
  – Stefan is represented by the Ascendant’s 9th house; with no planets in that house, his primary indicator is Mars (the house ruler)

2. Planetary Positions (with degree, sign, and house placement as provided)
 • Sun: 18°57′ Aquarius – located in the 1st House
 • Moon: 16°51′ Gemini – located in the 5th House
 • Mercury: 17°27′ Aquarius – located in the 1st House
 • Venus: 2°15′ Aries – located in the 2nd House
 • Mars: 18°47′ Cancer (retrograde) – located in the 6th House (Stefan’s representative)
 • Jupiter: 11°17′ Gemini – located in the 4th House
 • Saturn: 18°08′ Pisces – located in the 1st House
 • Uranus: 23°17′ Taurus – located in the 3rd House
 • Neptune: 28°09′ Pisces – located in the 2nd House
 • Pluto: 2°15′ Aquarius – located in the 12th House
 • North Node: 29°30′ Pisces – located in the 2nd House
 • Chiron: 19°42′ Aries – located in the 2nd House

3. House Structure (as provided)
 • 1st House (Ascendant): Starts at 3° Aquarius; contains Sun, Mercury, Saturn
 • 2nd House: Starts at 20° Pisces; contains Venus, Neptune, North Node, Chiron
 • 3rd House: Starts at 2° Taurus; contains Uranus
 • 4th House: Starts at 26° Taurus; contains Jupiter
 • 5th House: Starts at 14° Gemini; contains Moon
 • 6th House: Starts at 3° Cancer; contains Mars
 • 7th House: Starts at 3° Leo
 • 8th House: Starts at 20° Virgo
 • 9th House: Starts at 2° Scorpio
 • 10th House (MC): Starts at 26° Scorpio
 • 11th House: Starts at 14° Sagittarius
 • 12th House: Starts at 3° Capricorn; contains Pluto

 • Note on Representation: By the provided cross-reference, Ascendant’s 9th house corresponds to Stefan’s 12th house. With the 9th house being empty, Mars – as the ruling planet for that house – is taken as his key significator

4. Major Aspects (selected by horary relevance and order of significance)
 • Mars trine Saturn, orb 0°         – Indicates a stabilizing, decision-affirming influence involving Stefan’s representative
 • Mars square Chiron, orb 1°         – Suggests potential for hurt, delay, or internal conflict
 • Sun sextile Chiron, orb 1°         – Points to healing insights emerging from core identity
 • Moon trine Mercury, orb 1°         – Fosters communication and intuition
 • Pluto conjunction Ascendant, orb 1°     – Demands transformative change influencing Melissa’s perspective
 • Venus sextile Pluto, orb 0°         – Hints at hidden or transformative influences in relationship matters
 • Sun conjunction Mercury, orb 1°       – Merges thought and identity in the reading
 • Additional minor aspects (with orbs noted ranging 2°–8°) include:
  – Moon square Saturn (2°)
  – Mercury sextile Chiron (2°)
  – Neptune sextile IC (2°)
  – Neptune trine MC (2°)
  – Sun trine Moon (2°)

5. Configurational Patterns and Special Features
 • Grand Trine Pattern: Involving Mars (Cancer, 6th House), MC (Scorpio, 10th House), and Saturn (Pisces, in the 1st House)
 • Kite Pattern: Combining Mars, MC, Saturn and the influence of Uranus (Taurus, 3rd House)
 • Cradle Pattern: Involving MC, IC, North Node, Pluto, and Venus – indicating deeper transformational themes
 • Special Features:
  – The chart is described as a Bowl shape with the Air element dominant among the inner planets
  – Fixed mode is dominant among inner planets
  – Pluto appears as a rising factor, and Uranus along with the IC are on the Nadir
  – Sextile aspects occur frequently (15 instances in total)

This compilation represents all chart data relevant for a strict horary analysis of your inquiry. Provide further instructions or request clarification when ready to proceed with the interpretation.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Analyzing the horary chart with strict horary principles, we observe the following:

1. Stefan’s representation is taken from Mars in the 6th house. Note that Mars is retrograde in Cancer, which in horary work signals internal delays and a review of strong passions or conflicts.

2. The configuration Mars trine Saturn (orb 0°) indicates that, once discipline and resolution have had their due course, a decisive action will emerge. Saturn’s stabilizing influence suggests that a definitive decision is on the horizon when internal structures become realigned.

3. However, the square between Mars and Chiron (orb 1°) reveals that deep-seated wounds or a sense of vulnerability are actively interfering. This aspect points to an internal conflict—hurt that must be acknowledged and healed—before Stefan can fully commit.

4. Supporting energies come from the Moon trine Mercury and Sun sextile Chiron, indicating that intuitive communication and healing insights are available, though they do not yet dispel the hesitancy evidenced by Mars’s retrograde motion.

5. Venus sextile Pluto (orb 0°) and Pluto’s conjunction with the Ascendant further hint at transformative undercurrents in relationship dynamics. Such energies imply that both parties are subject to a deep shift, which may catalyze the decision once the personal transformation reaches a critical point.

6. Collectively, the planetary patterns (including the Grand Trine involving Mars, Saturn, and the MC, and the additional supportive configurations) indicate that while a final decision process is underway, unresolved emotional conflicts are impeding a swift conclusion. Stefan’s decision is not final yet; it is pending the resolution of his internal struggles and the stabilization of his internal commitments.

Based on these elements, the indication is that Stefan has not fully made his final decision about his marriage. The Martian energy, along with supportive transits from Saturn, suggests that as soon as he heals the wounds indicated by Chiron, his choice will crystallize. The timeline depends on the progression of these healing and restructuring processes.

Please advise if you require further clarification on any specific aspect of the reading.
swipes:
Analyzing the horary chart with strict horary principles, we observe the following:

1. Stefan’s representation is taken from Mars in the 6th house. Note that Mars is retrograde in Cancer, which in horary work signals internal delays and a review of strong passions or conflicts.

2. The configuration Mars trine Saturn (orb 0°) indicates that, once discipline and resolution have had their due course, a decisive action will emerge. Saturn’s stabilizing influence suggests that a definitive decision is on the horizon when internal structures become realigned.

3. However, the square between Mars and Chiron (orb 1°) reveals that deep-seated wounds or a sense of vulnerability are actively interfering. This aspect points to an internal conflict—hurt that must be acknowledged and healed—before Stefan can fully commit.

4. Supporting energies come from the Moon trine Mercury and Sun sextile Chiron, indicating that intuitive communication and healing insights are available, though they do not yet dispel the hesitancy evidenced by Mars’s retrograde motion.

5. Venus sextile Pluto (orb 0°) and Pluto’s conjunction with the Ascendant further hint at transformative undercurrents in relationship dynamics. Such energies imply that both parties are subject to a deep shift, which may catalyze the decision once the personal transformation reaches a critical point.

6. Collectively, the planetary patterns (including the Grand Trine involving Mars, Saturn, and the MC, and the additional supportive configurations) indicate that while a final decision process is underway, unresolved emotional conflicts are impeding a swift conclusion. Stefan’s decision is not final yet; it is pending the resolution of his internal struggles and the stabilization of his internal commitments.

Based on these elements, the indication is that Stefan has not fully made his final decision about his marriage. The Martian energy, along with supportive transits from Saturn, suggests that as soon as he heals the wounds indicated by Chiron, his choice will crystallize. The timeline depends on the progression of these healing and restructuring processes.
